columnOptions.description: Column definitions array - replaces V1 tableFields

valueFormat.structure: Array of AG Grid column definitions
valueFormat.notes: CRITICAL: Defines table structure using AG Grid format (not V1 format!). Each column needs 'field' (data property) and 'headerName' (column title). Optional: sortable, filter, width, pinned ('left'/'right'), cellRenderer for custom rendering. V2 is built on AG Grid - use AG Grid column definition format with all its features (valueFormatter, cellClass, cellStyle, etc.).
valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ field: string; headerName: string; sortable?: boolean; filter?: boolean; width?: number; pinned?: 'left' | 'right'; cellRenderer?: string; valueFormatter?: Function; }>
valueFormat.example: :column-options="[{ field: 'name', headerName: 'Name', sortable: true, filter: true }, { field: 'email', headerName: 'Email', width: 200 }]"

commonMistakes.impact: Column headers display as undefined or blank
commonMistakes.fix: Change all 'label' to 'headerName' in column definitions

commonMistakes.impact: Custom cell renderers don't work, cells show raw data
commonMistakes.fix: Use AG Grid cellRenderer format with component name strings

data.description: Table data array for client-side mode

valueFormat.notes: Array of data objects to display in the table. Each object represents one row, with properties matching column 'field' values. Only used in clientSide rowModelType. For serverSide mode, data is fetched from API via fetchUrl. Update this array to refresh table content (reactive).

totalData.description: Total number of records (for server-side pagination display)

valueFormat.notes: Total record count for server-side pagination. Used to calculate total pages and show 'X of Y' items. Only relevant in serverSide rowModelType - in clientSide mode, total is auto-calculated from data array length. Backend should return this in API response.

rowModelType.description: Data loading mode - replaces V1 apiMode

valueFormat.notes: Determines how table loads data. 'clientSide' (default) loads all data upfront into browser - use for <1000 rows. 'serverSide' fetches data paginated from API via fetchUrl - use for large datasets (10K+ rows). 'infinite' enables infinite scroll. CRITICAL V1 CHANGE: V1 used boolean api-mode, V2 uses string row-model-type.

commonMistakes.impact: Prop not recognized, table doesn't fetch from API

fetchUrl.description: API endpoint URL for server-side data fetching

valueFormat.notes: API endpoint URL for fetching table data in serverSide mode. Table will POST/GET (based on httpMethod) to this URL with pagination/filter/sort params. Requires rowModelType="serverSide". Backend should return data array and totalData count. Use tableSearchParams for additional custom params.

HTTP method used when fetching data from fetchUrl. GET sends params in query string, POST sends in request body. Use POST for complex filters or when URL length might exceed limits. Only relevant in serverSide rowModelType.

bulkActionsOptions.description: Bulk action buttons for selected rows

valueFormat.notes: Defines bulk action buttons shown when rows are selected. Each action needs id (unique identifier), label (button text). Optional: icon, variant ('danger' for destructive actions), disabled. Actions trigger @bulk-action event with actionId and selectedRows. Use for operations like export, delete, archive on multiple rows.
valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ id: string; label: string; icon?: string; variant?: string; disabled?: boolean; }>

valueFormat.notes: Shows bulk actions toolbar when rows are selected. Requires rowsSelection to be enabled and bulkActionsOptions to be provided. When true, toolbar appears above table showing action buttons and selected count. Essential for multi-row operations.

'multiple' allows selecting many rows with checkboxes, 'single' allows only one row selected at a time. Checkboxes appear in first column. Use with @select-status/@row-selected events to track selections. Essential for bulk operations or row-based actions.

canSelectAllRows.description: Enable select all checkbox in header

valueFormat.notes: Shows 'select all' checkbox in table header for selecting all rows at once. Only works with rowsSelection="multiple". When clicked, selects all visible rows (respects pagination). Use for bulk operations where users might want to select entire page.

rowHeight.description: Height of each row in pixels

valueFormat.notes: Row height preset or custom pixel value. 'small' (48px) for compact tables, 'medium' (64px) default for comfortable viewing, or custom number for specific height. Fixed row height improves scroll performance in large tables. AG Grid uses this for virtualization calculations.

Wraps entire table in InContainer component for consistent styling with headers, borders, shadows. Use inContainerLayoutOptions to configure container appearance (title, borders, etc.). Essential for matching Design System container patterns across application.

Configuration for InContainer wrapper when inContainerLayout=true. headerStatus adds header section, title sets header text, border adds container borders. Passes props directly to InContainer component. Use for consistent table presentation.
valueFormat.typescript: { headerStatus?: boolean; title?: string; border?: boolean; }

valueFormat.notes: Enables master-detail pattern with expandable rows showing nested tables. When row is expanded, shows child table with data from nestedTableFields columns. Perfect for orders→order items, users→permissions, invoices→line items. Emit @nested-data-ready to load nested data.

valueFormat.structure: Array of column definitions (same as columnOptions)
valueFormat.notes: Column definitions for the nested/child table shown when row expands. Same format as columnOptions - AG Grid column definitions. Used with nestedTableStatus. Define columns for child data structure (e.g., order items have product, quantity, price columns).
valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ field: string; headerName: string; width?: number; }>

valueFormat.notes: Displays hierarchical/tree data with expand/collapse functionality. Rows can have child rows creating tree structure (org charts, file systems, category hierarchies). Use groupDataPath to define how to access child nodes. Rows show expand/collapse icons automatically.

groupDataPath.description: Path to child nodes in tree data

valueFormat.notes: Function that returns path to child nodes in tree data structure. Used with isTreeData. Function receives row data and should return array of property names leading to children. Example: for org hierarchy stored in row.children, return ['children']. For nested like row.org.children, return ['org', 'children'].

searchFilterStatus.description: Show search input - replaces V1 withSearchFilter

valueFormat.notes: Shows global search input above table for filtering rows. Searches across all columns (client-side) or sends search param to API (server-side). V1 CHANGE: V1 used withSearchFilter, V2 uses searchFilterStatus. Emits @set-search-value event with search query.

Placeholder text shown in search input when empty. Use descriptive text like 'Search users...', 'Find orders...'. Helps users understand what they can search for. Only relevant when searchFilterStatus=true.

statusFilterStatus.description: Show status filter dropdown - replaces V1 withStatusFilter

valueFormat.notes: Shows status filter dropdown above table for filtering by predefined statuses. Options come from statusFilterList. Common for filtering by Active/Inactive, Published/Draft, etc. V1 CHANGE: V1 used withStatusFilter, V2 uses statusFilterStatus.

statusFilterList.description: Options for status filter - replaces V1 statusList

valueFormat.notes: Status options for the filter dropdown. Each option needs label (display text) and value (filter value sent to API). Used with statusFilterStatus. V1 CHANGE: V1 used statusList, V2 uses statusFilterList. Common values: Active/Inactive, All statuses, Published/Draft.
valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ label: string; value: string | number; }>

valueFormat.notes: Shows pagination controls below table (page numbers, prev/next buttons). Essential for large datasets. Works in both clientSide (splits data array) and serverSide (fetches pages from API) modes. Emits @pagination-changed when page changes.

Shows dropdown to change items per page (10, 25, 50, 100). Options range from minItemPerPage to maxItemPerPage. Allows users to control page size. Emits @per-page-selected when changed. Use with paginationStatus.

defaultItemPerPage.description: Default number of items per page - replaces V1 perPage

valueFormat.notes: Initial/default page size when table loads. V1 CHANGE: V1 used perPage, V2 uses defaultItemPerPage. Common values: 10 (default), 25, 50, 100. Choose based on data density and user needs. Smaller for detailed rows, larger for simple data.
Minimum page size option in items-per-page dropdown. Usually 10 or 25. Prevents users from selecting too small page sizes that require excessive clicking. Used to generate dropdown options.
Maximum page size option in items-per-page dropdown. Usually 100 or 200. Prevents performance issues from rendering too many rows at once. Used to generate dropdown options (min, default, max, etc.).

showingItemsStatus.description: Show 'Showing X of Y items' text

valueFormat.notes: Shows text like 'Showing 1-25 of 1,523 items' below table. Helps users understand current view and total data size. Especially useful in serverSide mode to show total from backend. Part of pagination information section.

Shows entire pagination info section (page count text, page size selector). Master toggle for pagination UI elements. When false, hides all pagination info except page number buttons. Use to simplify UI for small datasets.

Triggers loading state overlay on table. Shows spinner or skeleton based on loadingType. Use while fetching data (initial load or refresh). Prevents user interaction during load. Emits @loading-status event when changed.

Shows skeleton placeholder rows instead of spinner during loading. Better UX for initial load - users see table structure. Number of skeleton columns from horizontalSkeletonsCount. Use for first load, loadingStatus for refreshes.
valueFormat.example: skeleton-status // Show skeleton during initial load

horizontalSkeletonsCount.description: Number of skeleton columns to show

valueFormat.notes: Number of skeleton columns to render during skeleton loading. Should match actual column count for best visual effect. Default is 6. Used only when skeletonStatus=true or loadingType='skeleton'.

'skeleton' shows placeholder rows (better for initial load), 'spinner' shows loading spinner (better for refreshes). Determines loading UI when loadingStatus=true. Skeleton provides better perceived performance.

Title text shown in loading overlay. Appears above spinner/skeleton. Use descriptive text like 'Loading data...', 'Fetching users...'. Provides context during wait. Only shows when loadingStatus=true.
Subtitle/description text in loading overlay. Appears below title. Use for additional context like 'Please wait', 'This may take a moment'. Optional, can be empty for minimal UI.

noDataTitleText.description: Title when no data - replaces V1 noDataTitle

valueFormat.notes: Title text shown in empty state when table has no data. V1 CHANGE: V1 used noDataTitle, V2 uses noDataTitleText. Use clear messages like 'No results found', 'No users yet'. Helps users understand empty table.
valueFormat.example: no-data-title-text="No results found" // Empty state title

noDataDescriptionText.description: Description when no data - replaces V1 noDataDescription

valueFormat.notes: Description text shown below title in empty state. V1 CHANGE: V1 used noDataDescription, V2 uses noDataDescriptionText. Provide helpful guidance like 'Try adjusting filters', 'Click + to add first item'. Actionable suggestions improve UX.
valueFormat.example: no-data-description-text="Try adjusting your filters" // Empty state hint

valueFormat.notes: Customization options for empty state. icon sets empty state icon, buttonText shows action button, buttonAction defines click handler. Use to add 'Clear Filters', 'Add First Item' buttons in empty state. Makes empty state actionable.
valueFormat.typescript: { icon?: string; buttonText?: string; buttonAction?: Function; }

autoHeight.description: Auto-adjust table height based on content

valueFormat.notes: Table height automatically fits content (no vertical scroll). Grows/shrinks with row count. Use for small, variable datasets. DON'T use with large datasets - causes performance issues. Conflicts with fixedHeight. AG Grid disables virtualization with autoHeight.

Sets fixed table height in pixels. Table scrolls vertically when content exceeds height. Use for large datasets to maintain consistent UI. Enables AG Grid virtualization for performance. Conflicts with autoHeight. Common values: 400, 500, 600px.

Enables horizontal scrolling when columns exceed table width. Essential for tables with many columns. Use with pinned columns to keep important columns visible while scrolling. AG Grid handles scroll virtualization automatically.

Limits how many columns can be pinned (fixed left/right). Prevents users from pinning too many columns which hurts UX. When limit reached, emits @max-columns-pinned event. Common limit: 2-3 columns. Use to balance flexibility with usability.

Enables Excel-like cell range selection with mouse drag or Shift+Click. Users can select rectangular cell ranges. Useful for copy-paste operations or bulk cell editing. AG Grid provides built-in range selection UI and keyboard shortcuts.

Allows selecting and copying text inside cells. When false, prevents text selection (better for row selection UX). When true, users can select cell content for copying. Trade-off: easier copy vs cleaner row selection interaction.

rowDragManaged.description: Enable row drag and drop reordering

valueFormat.notes: Enables dragging rows to reorder them. Shows drag handle in first column. Emits @row-drag-end/@row-drag-stopped events with new order. Perfect for priority lists, task ordering, manual sorting. Use @row-drag-stopped to persist new order to backend.

customColumnMenuItems.description: Custom items for column context menu

valueFormat.notes: Adds custom items to column header context menu (right-click menu). Each item needs name (label) and action (click handler). Optional icon. Use for column-specific operations like 'Export Column', 'Hide Column', 'Pin Column'. Extends default AG Grid menu.
valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ name: string; action: Function; icon?: string; }>

valueFormat.notes: Enables mobile-optimized responsive behavior. Table adapts layout for small screens - columns may stack, simplified interactions. Use for mobile-first or responsive applications. May hide some columns on small screens automatically.

tableSearchParams.description: Additional parameters to send with search/filter requests in server-side mode

valueFormat.notes: Only used in serverSide row model. Merged with pagination/filter params in API requests

commonMistakes.impact: Params are ignored, not sent to API (no API calls in clientSide)
commonMistakes.fix: Only use with row-model-type="serverSide" for API fetching

commonMistakes.impact: Param changes don't trigger table refresh
commonMistakes.fix: Use ref/reactive: const params = ref({ status: 'active' })

dataLoaded.description: Emitted when table data is loaded

dataReady.description: Emitted when grid is ready with data

firstDataRendered.description: Emitted when first data is rendered

rowSelected.payload: { node: RowNode, data: any, selected: boolean }

allRowsSelected.description: Emitted when all rows are selected

bulkAction.description: Emitted when bulk action is triggered

cellClicked.payload: { colId: string, data: any, value: any }

maxColumnsPinned.description: Emitted when max pinned columns reached

copied.description: Emitted when data is copied to clipboard

nestedDataReady.description: Emitted when nested table data is ready

rowGroupStatusChanged.description: Emitted when row group expand/collapse changes

loadingStatus.notes: Emitted when table starts/stops loading data. Useful for showing global loading indicators

rowDragEnter.description: Emitted when dragged row enters a drop zone
rowDragEnter.payload: { node: RowNode, overNode: RowNode, event: DragEvent }
rowDragEnter.notes: Fires when dragging row over another row. Use with row-drag-managed prop

rowDragMove.payload: { node: RowNode, overNode: RowNode, event: DragEvent }
rowDragMove.notes: Fires continuously while dragging. Use for visual feedback during drag

rowDragLeave.description: Emitted when dragged row leaves a drop zone
rowDragLeave.payload: { node: RowNode, overNode: RowNode, event: DragEvent }
rowDragLeave.notes: Fires when drag exits a row area. Use to clear hover states

rowDragCancel.description: Emitted when row drag operation is cancelled
rowDragCancel.notes: Fires when user cancels drag (ESC key or invalid drop). Use to reset UI state

rowDragStopped.description: Emitted when row drag operation stops (successful or not)
rowDragStopped.notes: Always fires at end of drag operation. Use for cleanup regardless of success/failure

examples.title: Basic Client-Side Table
examples.code:
<InDataTableV2
  :data="users"
  :column-options="[
    { field: 'name', headerName: 'Name', sortable: true, filter: true },
    { field: 'email', headerName: 'Email', width: 200 },
    { field: 'status', headerName: 'Status' }
  ]"
  :default-item-per-page="10"
  pagination-status
  items-per-page-status
/>

examples.title: Server-Side Table with API
examples.code:
<InDataTableV2
  row-model-type="serverSide"
  fetch-url="/api/users"
  http-method="GET"
  :column-options="columns"
  :total-data="totalCount"
  :default-item-per-page="25"
  pagination-status
  search-filter-status
  search-filter-placeholder="Search users..."
  status-filter-status
  :status-filter-list="statusOptions"
  @data-loaded="handleLoad"
  @pagination-changed="handlePagination"
/>

examples.title: Table with Bulk Actions and Selection
examples.code:
<InDataTableV2
  :data="data"
  :column-options="columns"
  rows-selection="multiple"
  can-select-all-rows
  has-bulk-actions
  :bulk-actions-options="[
    { id: 'export', label: 'Export', icon: 'download' },
    { id: 'delete', label: 'Delete', icon: 'trash', variant: 'danger' }
  ]"
  @select-status="handleSelection"
  @bulk-action="handleBulkAction"
/>

examples.title: Table in Container with Header
examples.code:
<InDataTableV2
  :data="data"
  :column-options="columns"
  in-container-layout
  :in-container-layout-options="{
    headerStatus: true,
    title: 'User Management',
    border: true
  }"
  pagination-status
  showing-items-status
/>
